definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: She received several official letters this morning.
sentences.chinese: 她今天早晨收到了幾封公函。

sentences.english: Draft, print, deliver official letters, mails, faxes, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 起草，打印，發送各類公函，信件，傳真。

sentences.english: OFFICIAL】The letter should be written in an official style.
sentences.chinese: 這封信應寫成公函的形式。

sentences.english: The special communicative functions of business English letters decide their uniqueness in genre.
sentences.chinese: 商務英語公函的特殊交際功能決定了其體裁的特殊性。

definition: incoming letter/letter from afar/same as 来信
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
red-letterhead document, an official document with the name of the issuing government agency printed in red at the top, circulated to relevant bodies
receipt (written acknowledgement of receipt of an item)
secret documents/abbr. for 機密文件|机密文件
